title: Nice general purpose pub/restaurant in heart of Cambridge.
text: Bill's Cambridge is located on charming Green Street in the heart of the University district. Larger than many other pubs, it can accommodate a group if need be. A good selection of drinks and comfort foods. Service was helpful and friendly. A good place to hang out on a rainy day.

title: Nice afternoon tea
text: I have been to Harriet's several times, each time with a group of 15-20, which they were able to handle with aplomb. Make reservations if you do plan to go with a group. Harriet's provides a quality afternoon tea experience, with the usual selection of finger sandwiches, scones with clotted cream and jam, and sweet cakes. Located on the charming Green Street in Cambridge, amidst many other shops and establishments, in the heart of the university district. Having tea at Harriet's will enhance any visit to beautiful Cambridge.

title: One of the best coffee shops in Cannon Beach
text: This is a great coffee shop for either take-away (no drive through of course), or comfortably settle in on a rainy day. Just a block from the beach. Coffee is good, and the small selection of pastries even better. The berry scones and muffins are tasty with lots of berries baked in. Often pretty busy; I could wish they opened a little earlier than 8am, but that seems par for Cannon Beach establishments. Stop in, you won't be sorry.

title: Nice addition to Cannon Beach
text: This new establishment is inside of Morris's Fireside Restaurant, on the right after entering. The log construction and stone fireplace creates a nice ambiance, and there is a good selection of libations. So many places in Cannon Beach are closed by evening hours, so it nice to have a place where you can gather with friends in the evening for dessert and a drink. The music playlist is classic rock (Tom Petty, CCR, etc), and while you can hear it, I liked that the volume is low enough to encourage conversation. This is a cozy place, well worth a visit.

title: A Hong Kong experience
text: I'm not sure why this is called the "Ladies Market" as they have all kinds of goods there, and it seems very similar to the Night market on Temple street. Just walking around and soaking in the street life is fun, if you like that sort of thing, and you can find some bargains especially if you are willing to haggle. Men's and women's scarves can be a particularly good deal, and many are of pretty good quality. A visit here or one of the other street markets is a cultural experience, not to be missed on a visit to Hong Kong. Expect crowds and being jostled around a bit. Secure your personal belongings, as pick pockets are said to roam. Lots of good street food available.

title: Stunning views of Hong Kong
text: The Sky 100 observation deck on the 100th floor of the International Commerce Centre is well worth a visit for the incredible views. There is no fee to go up and look around, and there are shops and cafes if you want them. Great views of the harbor and city. This is not even the top floor of the building, but at 100 floors up, you get an unforgettable panorama of Hong Kong.

title: Walk through history
text: The Roman Forum is an incredible experience, walking amongst the buildings and ruins of Roman history. I enjoy historic places and spaces more than museums, and the Forum certainly meets that description. It is free and open to walk through, but it would help to have read some background, and have a map or brochure to understand what you are seeing, or to pay a guide. Take your time and soak it in.

title: Savory or sweet!
text: Crepe Neptune in Cannon Beach is just a hole in the wall shop, but the crepes are wonderful. They have a variety of savory crepes, but my favorites are the dessert crepes, which make a great breakfast. I like the one with Nutella, fresh strawberries and bananas, and whipped cream.

title: Quaint setting, great food
text: After many visits to Cannon Beach I finally made a stop in the Lazy Susan Cafe for brunch. I had the shrimp omelet and sauteed potatoes, and it was very good. The cafe is small but cozy, and you may need to wait for a table. The staff is super friendly and service is great. Note that they only take cash.

title: Original art in a coastal setting
text: The Jeffrey Hull Gallery in Cannon Beach is a delight. Specializing in local coastal settings, the Gallery features a wide range of paintings of various price ranges. The second floor gallery itself is large and provides plenty of space for peaceful reflection. It is well worth a visit anytime one is in Cannon Beach. If Jeffrey is in, he is a gracious host and interpreter of his art.

title: Great beach location
text: The town of Cannon Beach is one of the gems of the Oregon coast. The Waves motel is a perfect location from which to enjoy it. Guests enjoy a wonderful view and easy beach access, as well as easy walking distance to much of the town with shops, galleries, restaurants, etc. I have stayed here many times, and always find the staff to be so helpful. The Waves is a great combination of comfort and "beach casual." There is a variety of room types and configurations to suit various needs and budgets.

title: Nice hotel, great location
text: I have stayed twice at the London House Hotel in the past several months, once in one of the small single rooms, and once in a double bed room. Rooms are clean and efficiently appointed. The bathrooms were very clean and updated. Staff and management are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good and worth the price. The lobby area is small and I missed having some sort of on-site lounge or fitness room. The location is great, within walking distance of many shops and restaurants, Hyde Park, as well as two nearby tube stations (Queensway and Bayswater). Overall a very nice experience, one I recommend to others.

title: Amazing experience!
text: I have twice been to Victoria Peak in the past several years. The view of the city is breathtaking and worthy of some great photo memories. It is crowded, yes, but is one of the must-do experiences on a visit to Hong Kong.

title: Very good hotel in Hong Kong
text: I stayed at this hotel with a group visiting Hong Kong for a conference. Service was good, and rooms are large and well equipped. Conference facilities worked very well for our group of about 65. The hotel is a short walk from the metro, and there are lots of shops on the group floor and on the streets nearby. The staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Like a trip back in time
text: I have ridden the Star Ferry several times in a couple of trips to Hong Kong. It is the best view and best mode of transport in Hong Kong--affordable and fun. The ferries are vintage boats, but in good shape. It makes one feel like a traveler from back in the 1940s.

title: Great experience
text: A colleague had done business with Sandy at Star Tailors, and took several of us who were there visiting Hong Kong for work. We had an appointment, and Sandy created a great experience for us. I ordered a wool and cashmere suit. We took our time choosing fabrics and talking about styles, and Sandy carefully took our measurements. We returned for the fitting several days later, and our completed suits were delivered to our hotel by the end of the week. Mine fits perfectly and gets tons of compliments. I will certainly plan to return and have another made the next time I am in Hong Kong.

title: Relaxing and scenic
text: I take a group of 20 or so American grad students to Cambridge every year, and we have gone punting with "Let's Go Punting!" as a fun experience several times. Their online booking for a group has been efficient and problem-free, and the experience itself is a relaxing way to see historic Cambridge from another angle. Boats are safe and stable, and the staff is knowledgeable and fun. There are several punting companies in Cambridge to choose from, but we have been happy with Let's Go Punting! every time we have used them.

title: Step into history
text: The "Round Church" is one of the iconic locations and images of Cambridge. At 900 years old, it is incredibly well preserved and peaceful inside. The Christian Heritage foundation operates the building, and has a very informative visual and audio interpretation of the history of Cambridge and its Christian influence. The modest fee is well worth it.

title: Good overview of the city
text: The City Sightseeing bus tours are a great way to get an overview of the city if time is limited. Cambridge is a great walking city, but this tour gets you around to places you may not see otherwise, including the American WWII military cemetery outside of town. Well worth the modest fee.
place: City Sightseeing Cambridge Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour

title: Iconic
text: A visit to Athens would not be complete without experiencing this most iconic of its locations. After hearing the history, it is amazing that the buildings are as well-preserved as they are. The walk up the hill is not difficult, but could be a challenge for those with mobility issues. Many of the marble stones in the path are worn smooth and could be slippery, especially if damp.

title: Impressive and inspiring
text: This building is breathtakingly beautiful and so well-preserved, it is hard to comprehend that it is nearly 2000 years old. It is centrally located and free to enter, so well worth the visit.

title: One stop shopping
text: Oxford's open market is a great place for both locals and tourists. You can find everything from hats and scarves, to cheese or flowers. Fun to browse there--I only wish it stayed open just a bit later.

title: More than meets the eye
text: From the street this looks like a modest, store-front bookshop. But it actually it is a huge, multi-level mega-bookstore. Knowledgeable staff, and fun to just browse. An on-site coffee shop and toilets invite guests to linger. A must-see on a visit to Oxford.

title: Nice shop for souvenirs or gifts
text: A cozy little shop where you can find all things Alice in Wonderland. Situated right across the street from Christ Church college, where Lewis Carroll taught at the time that he wrote the book. The shop has curated this history since the 1870s. A good place to find a gift or souvenir.

title: Outstanding flight
text: This was a direct flight from London to Portland, and a great experience for an economy flight. Flight boarded and departed on time, and was staff by an experienced crew. The flight was not full, and I had an empty seat on each side of me, which helped a lot. Amenities included a complimentary wine cocktail, a menu with choice of meals, a warm chocolate chip cookie, and hot towels at the beginning and end of the flight. Everything about it made a long flight more bearable. Great job, Delta!

title: Great service!
text: I have stayed at this Ibis several times in recent years and always have a good experience. Their check-in service was particularly outstanding. Young attendants wearing a "Welcome Home" T-shirt met us as we came in the front and quickly got us checked in and supplied with information on everything we needed, including taxi reservations for the airport in the morning. The rooms and breakfast area were very good, as usual.
